source: AIHSR Risk Reference Tool v1.5 (Tamiko Eto)

mitigationCategories.name: Governance & Oversight
mitigationCategories.description: Organizational structures and processes for AI accountability

strategies.name: Board Structure & Oversight
strategies.description: Establish appropriate governance boards and oversight committees

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Identify stakeholders who should have oversight of AI development. Document reporting relationships and decision authority for the research team.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Establish a review committee or advisory board to evaluate validation results and approve progression to deployment. Define escalation paths for safety concerns.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Implement formal governance board with regular review cycles, documented meeting minutes, and authority to pause or modify deployed systems based on performance data.

strategies.name: Risk Management
strategies.description: Pre-deployment risk assessments, independent risk assessment

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Conduct initial risk assessment identifying potential harms from the AI system. Document assumptions, limitations, and failure modes. Create risk register with likelihood and impact ratings.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Update risk assessment based on validation findings. Conduct independent review of risk documentation. Test identified failure modes and document mitigation effectiveness.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Maintain living risk register with regular reviews. Conduct periodic independent risk assessments. Track risk indicators and trigger reassessment when thresholds are exceeded.

strategies.name: Conflict of Interest Protections
strategies.description: Identify and manage conflicts of interest in AI development and deployment

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Document team members' financial interests, institutional pressures, and career incentives that could influence AI development decisions. Establish disclosure requirements.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Ensure validation is conducted by individuals without vested interest in positive outcomes. Document any conflicts and how they are managed during evaluation.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Implement formal conflict of interest policies covering all personnel involved in deployment decisions. Require annual disclosures and recusal procedures for conflicted parties.

strategies.name: Whistleblower Reporting & Protection
strategies.description: Establish channels for reporting concerns with protection for reporters

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Communicate to team members that safety concerns should be raised and will be taken seriously. Document the process for escalating concerns during development.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Establish clear channels for validation team members to report concerns about results or pressure to approve. Ensure reporters face no retaliation.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Implement formal whistleblower policy with anonymous reporting options, investigation procedures, and documented protections. Train all staff on reporting procedures.

strategies.name: Safety Decision Frameworks
strategies.description: Structured frameworks for making safety-related decisions

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Define criteria for what constitutes acceptable vs. unacceptable AI behavior. Document decision rules for common safety scenarios encountered during development.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Apply safety framework to validation results. Document go/no-go criteria for deployment. Establish thresholds for performance, fairness, and safety metrics.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Maintain documented decision framework for operational safety decisions. Define automatic triggers for system pause, human review requirements, and escalation procedures.

strategies.name: Environmental Impact Management
strategies.description: Assess and mitigate environmental impacts of AI systems

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Estimate computational resources required for model training. Consider energy-efficient architectures where feasible without compromising research goals.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Document energy consumption during validation. Evaluate trade-offs between model complexity and environmental impact.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Monitor and report ongoing energy consumption. Implement efficiency optimizations for inference. Consider carbon offset or renewable energy for sustained operations.

strategies.name: Societal Impact Assessment
strategies.description: Evaluate broader societal implications of AI deployment

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Consider how the AI system might affect different populations, employment, or social structures. Document intended benefits and potential unintended consequences.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Conduct structured assessment of societal implications based on validation findings. Engage community stakeholders or patient advocates in evaluation where appropriate.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Monitor societal effects of deployment. Establish feedback mechanisms for affected communities. Conduct periodic reassessment of broader impacts and adjust deployment as needed.

mitigationCategories.name: Technical & Security
mitigationCategories.description: Technical safeguards built into the AI system

strategies.name: Model & Infrastructure Security
strategies.description: Secure model storage, access controls, and infrastructure protection

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Implement basic security for development environment. Secure training data storage. Use version control with access logging for model artifacts.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Apply security controls to validation environment. Protect test data. Ensure model weights and configurations are securely stored with access controls.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Implement production-grade security including encryption at rest and in transit, network segmentation, intrusion detection, and regular security assessments.

strategies.name: Model Alignment
strategies.description: Ensure model behavior aligns with intended objectives and values

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Define intended model behavior and values explicitly. Design training objectives that capture desired outcomes. Consider potential misalignment between optimization target and true goals.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Test model behavior against intended objectives across diverse scenarios. Evaluate for goal drift or unexpected optimization. Document alignment with original design intent.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Monitor for alignment drift in production. Implement checks that model continues to optimize for intended outcomes. Retrain or adjust as needed when misalignment is detected.

strategies.name: Model Safety Engineering
strategies.description: Design and implement safety features in model architecture

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Incorporate safety considerations into model architecture. Design for graceful degradation. Build in uncertainty quantification where appropriate for the model type.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Validate safety features function as designed. Test failure modes and recovery mechanisms. Evaluate robustness to adversarial or out-of-distribution inputs.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Maintain safety features through model updates. Monitor safety mechanism effectiveness. Update safety engineering as new risks or attack vectors emerge.

strategies.name: Content Safety Controls
strategies.description: Filters and controls to prevent harmful content generation

phaseGuidance.phase-1: For generative models, design output filtering mechanisms. Define categories of harmful content relevant to the use case. Plan validation approach for content safety.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Test content filters against known harmful patterns. Red-team the system to identify filter bypasses. Validate filters don't inappropriately block legitimate content.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Deploy content safety with real-time monitoring. Maintain and update filter rules as new patterns emerge. Log filtered content for analysis and filter improvement.

mitigationCategories.name: Operational Process
mitigationCategories.description: Procedures for safe development and deployment

strategies.name: Testing & Auditing
strategies.description: Comprehensive testing and regular auditing of AI systems

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Establish testing approach for model development. Define test cases covering expected use cases, edge cases, and failure scenarios. Plan for bias and fairness testing.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Execute comprehensive test suite on validation data. Conduct independent audit of model performance. Document all test results and identified issues.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Implement continuous testing in production. Conduct periodic independent audits. Maintain audit trail of all model changes and their test results.

strategies.name: Data Governance
strategies.description: Policies and procedures for data management and quality

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Document data sources, collection methods, and known limitations. Implement data quality checks. Ensure proper consent and authorization for data use.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Validate data quality for test datasets. Document data lineage for validation results. Ensure validation data is appropriately independent from training data.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Maintain data governance for production inputs. Monitor data quality in real-time. Implement data retention and deletion policies compliant with regulations.

strategies.name: Access Management
strategies.description: Control and monitor access to AI systems and data

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Implement role-based access to development resources. Limit access to training data to authorized personnel. Log access to sensitive resources.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Control access to validation environment and results. Ensure only authorized personnel can approve progression. Document access during validation period.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Implement production access controls with principle of least privilege. Monitor and audit all access. Implement automatic access revocation for departing personnel.

strategies.name: Staged Deployment
strategies.description: Gradual rollout with checkpoints and evaluation

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Plan deployment stages and criteria for progression between stages. Identify pilot populations or use cases for initial deployment.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Define go/no-go criteria for each deployment stage. Establish monitoring approach for staged rollout. Plan rollback procedures if issues arise.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Execute staged deployment starting with limited scope. Monitor closely at each stage before expanding. Document lessons learned and adjust approach for subsequent stages.

strategies.name: Post-Deployment Monitoring
strategies.description: Ongoing monitoring of AI performance after deployment

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Define key metrics to monitor in production. Plan monitoring infrastructure and alerting thresholds.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Pilot monitoring approach during validation. Test alerting mechanisms. Establish baseline metrics for comparison during deployment.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Implement continuous monitoring of model performance, fairness metrics, and safety indicators. Set up automated alerts for anomalies. Conduct regular performance reviews.

strategies.name: Incident Response & Recovery
strategies.description: Procedures for responding to and recovering from incidents

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Document known failure modes and planned responses. Establish communication plan for issues discovered during development.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Develop incident response procedures based on validation findings. Test rollback and recovery mechanisms. Train team on incident procedures.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Implement formal incident response with defined roles, communication protocols, and escalation paths. Maintain ability to rapidly pause or rollback system. Conduct post-incident reviews.

strategies.name: System Documentation
strategies.description: Comprehensive documentation of AI system design and behavior

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Document model architecture, training data, intended use cases, and known limitations. Create model card or similar documentation artifact.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Document validation methodology, results, and conclusions. Update system documentation based on validation findings.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Maintain up-to-date documentation for deployed system. Document all changes, their rationale, and validation. Ensure documentation is accessible to relevant stakeholders.

strategies.name: Risk Disclosure
strategies.description: Clear communication of risks to stakeholders

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Document known risks and limitations for internal stakeholders. Prepare risk communication appropriate to audience.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Disclose validation results including limitations and residual risks to decision-makers. Ensure informed consent documents reflect AI use and associated risks.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Provide clear risk disclosure to users and affected parties. Update disclosures as new risks are identified. Ensure disclosures are understandable to intended audience.

strategies.name: Incident Reporting
strategies.description: Systems for reporting and tracking incidents

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Establish tracking for issues discovered during development. Document resolution of identified problems.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Implement incident tracking for validation phase. Categorize and prioritize issues. Track resolution status.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Deploy formal incident reporting system with categorization, prioritization, and tracking. Report to relevant authorities as required. Analyze trends for systemic improvements.

strategies.name: Governance Disclosure
strategies.description: Transparency about governance structures and decisions

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Document decision-making authority and accountability for AI development within the research team.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Disclose governance structure to IRB and relevant oversight bodies. Document how decisions are made about progression to deployment.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Publicly document governance structure for deployed AI. Disclose how oversight is conducted and decisions are made. Provide accountability information.

strategies.name: Third-Party System Access
strategies.description: Controls for third-party access and integration

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Consider whether third-party audit or review would be valuable. Plan for external evaluation if appropriate.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Enable independent validation by qualified third parties if feasible. Document any third-party access and findings.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Provide structured access for qualified researchers or auditors. Define access procedures and requirements. Track and document all third-party evaluations.

strategies.name: User Rights & Recourse
strategies.description: Mechanisms for users to understand and contest AI decisions

phaseGuidance.phase-1: Consider what rights users should have regarding AI decisions. Plan explanation and recourse mechanisms appropriate to use case.
phaseGuidance.phase-2: Test explanation mechanisms with representative users. Validate that recourse processes are functional and accessible.
phaseGuidance.phase-3: Implement clear procedures for users to request explanations of AI decisions and to contest decisions they believe are incorrect. Ensure timely response to user concerns.

riskTypes.name: Distributional
riskTypes.description: Risks that affect how benefits and harms are distributed across groups

riskTypes.name: Interactional
riskTypes.description: Risks that arise from human-AI interaction

riskTypes.name: Systemic
riskTypes.description: Risks that affect broader systems and structures

preventive.name: Preventive
preventive.description: Stops problems before they occur through design, policy, or access controls

detective.name: Detective
detective.description: Identifies problems when they occur through monitoring, testing, or auditing

corrective.name: Corrective
corrective.description: Fixes problems after detection through response procedures, rollback, or remediation
